title: The history of apples
desc: Wikipedia: Due to the genetic variability in Central Asia, this region is generally considered the center of origin for apples.[19] The apple is thought to have been domesticated 4000-10000 years ago in the Tian Shan mountains, and then to have travelled along the Silk Road to Europe, with hybridization and introgression of wild crabapples from Siberia (M. baccata), the Caucasus (M. orientalis), and Europe (M. sylvestris).

title: Crab Pie
desc: Wikipedia: Crab meat or crab marrow is the meat found within a crab, or more specifically, the leg of a crab. It is used in many cuisines around the world, prized for its soft, delicate and sweet taste.

title: Horse Soup/Stew
desc: In some parts of the world, horse meat is very popular. It can even be the basis for a soup!

title: Sandwich
desc: Wikipedia: A sandwich is a food typically consisting of vegetables, sliced cheese or meat, placed on or between slices of bread, or more generally any dish wherein bread serves as a container or wrapper for another food type.

title: Hamburger
desc: Wikipedia: Burgers can also be made with patties made from ingredients other than beef.[40] For example, a turkey burger uses ground turkey meat, a chicken burger uses ground chicken meat.

title: Serving sizes: An increase
desc: Healthline: Portion distortion is an effect in which you eat more if you are served more food â€” sometimes more than your body needs. The rise of portion distortion in the West stems from supersized convenience foods such as fast-food and restaurant meals and packaged foods.
